basics.name: William Pohaku Kepler
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for two majors at the University of Hawaii. First, a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences, and second, a B.S. in Natural Resources and Environmental Management under the College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

education.area: Natural Resources and Environmental Management, with a Computer Science minor (expected Spring, 2024)

work.company: UH Manoa Campus Center ID and Information Office
work.summary: Assist customers in obtaining UH IDs, book passport appointments, answer phones, and file in-house paperwork for UH.
highlights: Work as a useful part of a team that has a diverse range of functions
Clear communications and excellent customer service

work.company: Kaulunani Department of Urban Forestry -- State of Hawaii Division of Forestry and Wildlife
work.summary: Researched urban tree presence and green infrastructure infrastructure cover for the State of Hawaii, writing a 52 page technical paper, and contributing to research that was presented at the Arbor Day Partners in Community Forestry Conference in Seattle, Washington.
highlights: Created a first-of-its-kind report on tree and ecosystem equity in Honolulu
Created Landcover Data for all zipcodes on the island of Oahu, data which had not been previously available anywhere
Quantified the monetary value of Honolulu's Urban Trees using iTree Eco
Worked extensively with ArcGIS pro and ArcGIS online
Related key demographic indicators with tree value, presence, and canopy cover over 100+ census tracts of Oahu.

work.summary: Worked in all departments of a short-term rentals firm on Maui, including operations, housekeeping, bookkeeping, scheduling, service, and maintence.
highlights: Created digitized walk-through tours of rentals
Responed to customer calls and inquiries
Learned digital records keeping systems for real estate

volunteer.summary: This was a project I founded in order to benefit Habitat for Humanity Maui, by asking realtors to donate to affordable housing on the island. It ended up raising over $14,000.
Volunteered for four straight days every summer from 2017 to 2019 at a camp for disabled children on Maui
highlights: Worked with and befriended special-needs youth through group activities

awards.title: Valedictorian
awards.summary: Graduated at the top of my high school class, with the highest GPA in the schools history.

awards.title: Chancellors Scholarship
